newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Hutchison Paging sees break even in 2/3 years.
newsitem.headline: Hutchison Paging sees break even in 2/3 years.

text.p: Hutchison Paging, one of three new competitors in the Singapore paging market from April 1, said on Wednesday it expected to break even in two or three years.

Hutchison Paging chief executive officer Raphael Goh said his company expected to build a base of around 200,000 pager subscribers over the next two or three years, which would be equivalent of around 20 percent of the current Singapore market.
Goh said he expected the market to grow to around 1.5 million subscribers over the same period.
"The more numbers we get, the better off we will be," he told a news conference.
"We expect to break even within two or three years," he said.
Hutchison Paging is a joint venture of Hong Kong's Hutchison Whampoa, Singapore conglomerate Intraco Ltd, and Teledata (Singapore).
The Singapore paging market is now a monopoly rug by Singapore Telecommunications Ltd (SingTel)
